title: Cocoon
description:
I had the honour of being the UI designer for the award-winning Cocoon from Geometric Interactive. 
 Through the loading interface, which you can see below, you get a visual summary of the entire game. Complex worlds simplified into a single display. In the spirit of how the game itself unfolds, not everything is explained. You have to explore to make sense of it, and it becomes intuitive and logical.

media.mediaText: The loading interface design. A circular navigation feels right for a game that to a large extent revolves around orbs and plays with circular time perception.

media.alt: Some assorted UI elements for Cocoon
media.mediaText: Assorted UI elements from around the menu. A mix of samples from the process and final designs. The silhouettes are stylized depictions of creature designs by the game's art director Erwin Kho.
Design process for a loading indicator.
Animated ideation. Low-poly orbs have many potentials.

title: Trailmakers
description:
Trailmakers places you in an open world with tools for constructing complicated vehicles to aid your exploration. In collaboration with creative director Mikkel Thorsted I had lots of fun helping with ideate, designing and implementing the UI / UX. The challenge was to give the player the most intuitive possible approach to building a 3D vehicle on a flat screen – similar to building with Lego, but without the physical aspect. And with the addition of rocket engines. 
 Apart from the building interface, I also worked on the inventory for the many blocks you find on your journey, which have to be sorted and stored in a way that makes all parts easily accessible.

media.mediaText: UI ideation – camera orientated 3D indicators inside 2D buttons for rotating blocks around X, Y and Z axes respectively. Compensation for the lack of depth perception on a normal monitor.
UI ideation – radial vs classic UI, each of them have their own qualities. Also optimized for optional keyboard navigation
UI ideation – sketches of structure, look and feel of the inventory, as well as visual brainstorming on the 'mirroring' UX, making it faster to build symmetrically.

title: Kalimba
description: Kalimba is a physics-based puzzle platformer with the distinct graphical approach that everything is build of triangles. When the game was ported to iOS / iPadOS I helped with rethinking the UI to make it touch-friendly. As something new for the menu, I decided to approach the game world's triangular grid (or trixel grid) as a strict dogma. So I created everything in the UI out of triangles. This way the UI blends naturally into the game world, rather than being a layer on top of it.

title: Ro/På
description:
A fictional service made with Mikkel Kortsen Sørensen. After interviewing a number of subjects, questioning their use of digital health services, we found that many people were misinformed and scared by the information they found online. We wanted to provide validated information in a calm and reassuring way. 
 "Ro/På" (loosely translated to "don't worry") is a suggestion for how the The Danish Health Authority could provide us with validated information, served in proportion to how common or rare the illness is, and with thorough guidance for how to treat it.
